Developing and deploy models and/or adapt existing machine learning methods to meet project objectives
Building algorithms and design experiments to merge, manage, interrogate and extract data and gain insights

At ING we put our Customers at the forefront of everything we do, through the leading products we offer, to the experience our customers have with us. A driving force behind our success is that we’re always using data to understand what it is our customers want, and helping our internal teams ensure that we’re building products and systems to meet / exceed those demands.
Which is a great segue to the role we have available, a Data Scientist, who would be joining our customer interactions team and would be responsible for establishing and developing ING’s advanced analytics capability.
We’re looking for someone who has a deep understanding of data exploration, analysis, and development of insights, with a focus specifically relating to automated decision making through machine learning. If you want to work at a place where we believe that you can make a difference by using machine learning to generate data driven products and solve the most pressing data challenges, then this role is definitely one you shouldn’t miss!
What are you going to do? You will…

Job Title: Data Scientist - Procan Cancer Data Science (CDS)
Job Description:
Make an important contribution to the health of future generations through medical research
Work with a world-leading, independent medical research institute
Located in Westmead—Sydney’s and Australia’s foremost biomedical research precinct
Children’s Medical Research Institute (CMRI) was Australia’s first dedicated paediatric research facility and is now one of the world’s most highly regarded independent medical research organisations. Our research focuses on the four key areas impacting children’s health: cancer, genomics and genetic diseases, neurobiology, and embryology. Our strong international reputation is based on decades of significant research outcomes in these areas of specialty. CMRI is also home to the world-first proteomics project, ProCan, which is changing the way cancer is diagnosed and treated. CMRI’s research programs are supported by state of the art facilities and committed research and support staff. Our achievements are made possible by a loyal network of community supporters, highly engaged donors, and the very successful Jeans for Genes® and Great Cycle Challenge fundraising campaigns.

12-month Contract in a research institute committed to making a difference
Part time role (19 -22.8 hours per week) + Flexible working options
Attractive Salary $93,616 - $108,451 per annum (pro rata) + Super
Salary Packaging Benefits

Who We Are

Murdoch Children’s Research Institute (MCRI)

At MCRI we share a powerful vision; to re-imagine the future of child health. We are the home to many life-changing scientific discoveries. We believe that no question is too impossible to try and answer. We are renowned for our cutting edge focus on early interventions, improved diagnosis, prevention and development of potential cures. Our success is founded on a philosophy of collaboration through a multi-disciplinary approach to solving the toughest questions in child health. MCRI is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity, equity and respect that celebrates and values the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our people. We strive to foster a positive working environment that is underpinned by equal opportunity for all and consideration for the diverse voices of our people and the communities we serve. MCRI is a proud member of the Australian Network on Disability and is a committed subscriber to Science Australia Gender Equity (SAGE) and its principles.


The Health Services Research Unit (HSRU) works in partnership with the Health Services group within the Murdoch Children’s Research Institute (MCRI) and supports the development and use of the best available evidence to increase the quality, accessibility, and value of children’s healthcare. It provides real-time information to guide approaches to delivering the best and most cost-efficient care for children. Projects within the Unit aim to reduce inequity and improve health outcomes for children across Victoria and Australia.

The Data Scientist will work on a wide range of health services research projects, which are likely include the piloting and evaluation of a virtual emergency care model, evaluation of mental health services in north-western Melbourne, and evaluation of new approaches to improve outpatient clinic efficiency at The Royal Children’s Hospital.

This is an exciting opportunity for a savvy Data Scientist to employ their analytical skills and contribute to solving problems in the non for-profit sector.


Developing statistical analysis plans in collaboration with lead investigators
Data cleaning, management and analysis of hospital and linked administrative health data
Contributing to following and maintaining good data management practices including data storage and backup procedures
Creating/overseeing final annotated program files (R or Stata do‐files) that become the permanent, concise record of a coherent set of analyses
Contributing to the write‐up of reports and peer‐reviewed publications arising from the research, with co-authorship where intellectual contribution warrants


PhD/Masters qualification in Statistics, Epidemiology, Maths, Data Science or related discipline
Demonstrated quantitative statistical analysis skills, including experience with preparing and analysing health data, linked health datasets, and program language (eg. R, STATA, or Python)
Demonstrated understanding of a range of research methodologies and their application in empirical research
Understanding and experience of working on multi-faceted projects with busy health professionals
Appreciation for or experience of qualitative research methods and how they combine with quantitative analyses to inform health policy and practice

Register your interest here to receive updates on new Data Graduate positions as they become available.

What is the Australian Government Graduate Program - Data Stream?

The Australian Government Graduate Program - Data Stream is a program offering recent graduates permanent employment across the Australian Government. The Data Stream is led by the Australian Bureau of Statistics who recruit for data roles on behalf of the Australian Government.

One application for a Data Graduate position gives you access to opportunities across Australia in multiple agencies.

A wide range of data graduate roles will be recruited for, including Data Analysts, Data Scientists and Statistical & Mathematical roles.



Some of the agencies you may be able to work at include:

There are no requirements for any particular degrees or disciplines though graduates who have undertaken data related, statistics and maths subjects are more likely to be successful.

About the Role
AB MAURI is a global family of yeast and bakery ingredient companies and one of the largest producers and distributors in the world, striving to be the leaders of innovation within the industry. With over 6,000 employees working across 52 plants, operations in 32 countries and sales in over 100 countries, AB MAURI is Associated British Foods' (ABF) most globally represented business.
We have an excellent opportunity available for a qualified Culture Collection Microbiologist to join the Culture Collection Team at our Global Technology Centre in North Ryde.
The AB Mauri Culture Collection Team, reporting to the Culture Collection Team Leader, is responsible for the maintenance of the expanding AB Mauri culture collection. This team supports both the global yeast plants (providing certified starter cultures to ensure product quality) and the Research & Development team providing cultures as the basis of new technology development. As new strains are obtained from internal and external sources the Culture Collection team ensure the identity and quality of the cultures before entering them into the collated AB Mauri Culture Collection.

This is a fantastic opportunity to develop your career a highly reputable global business.

Previous experience in Yeast microbiology, genetic techniques and Yeast strain assessment would be an advantage.

About Spectrum

Spectrum is the personality disorder and complex trauma service for Victoria, funded by the Department of Health and provided by Eastern Health. Spectrum provides direct clinical care for people with complex and/or severe personality disorders as well as secondary consultations and second opinions for clinicians who support the needs of clients experiencing BPD. Spectrum also offers a range of workforce development opportunities including training and carer support workshops. Spectrum’s translational research program includes collaborative projects with a range of university, government and community organisations as well as evaluation of Spectrum treatment programs.

The role

This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic organisation to support a range of research projects within an established research team. The scope of work includes externally funded projects, internal evaluations, collaborative projects, and co-supervision of student-led research. The role entails ongoing contribution to project development, approval processes, contributing to and assisting with data collection and analysis, and contribution to dissemination activities.

Key Selection Criteria

A strong interest in personality disorder and/or trauma research and/or previous experience working with people who have complex needs (e.g., Mental health, AOD, disability)

Demonstrated research skills including conducting literature reviews and preparation of applications for ethics and governance approval

Prior experience in research project planning, data collection, data entry, data analysis, and report-writing

High level of attention to detail, including accurate scheduling, data collection and record keeping

Demonstrated ability to work effectively, both independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team, and to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to achieve project outcomes

Well-developed computing skills, including word processing (e.g. Microsoft Office) and database software packages (e.g. SPSS, Stata, Nvivo, Access)

Excellent organisational and interpersonal skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Commitment to working as part of a team

Job Title: APS 5, 6 (Multiple Classifications) - Geospatial Data Analyst / Geospatial Data Scientist
Job Description:
$78,143 - $97,790 (plus Super)
Russell - ACT
The Role
APS5/6 – Data Analyst

This role will leverage your understanding of statistics, Geospatial Information Systems (GIS), and programming. You will work as part of a team to develop and implement new tools and methodologies that use AGO’s data and GIS more effectively and efficiently. You will work with a range of stakeholders, including AGO’s intelligence analysts, data scientists and capability managers, ensuring your analytics meet user requirements, are rigorous and consistent with AGO’s system environment.

APS5/6 – Data Scientist

This role will leverage your experience in Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI), data analysis and automation, to assist AGO to derive deeper insights from larger volumes of data, and at a pace that enables decision advantage. You will liaise with a range of stakeholders to evaluate and implement ML/AI technologies that drive innovation and modernise AGO’s analytic practices.

Both roles will support AGO staff to increase their digital and data fluency.


The Australian Geospatial-Intelligence Organisation (AGO) makes a critical contribution to protect the lives and safety of Australians at home and overseas by providing accurate and timely geospatial-intelligence to support decision makers at all levels.

The Data Innovation and Analytics Directorate (DIAD) is a team of highly motivated data specialists who provide analytical support to AGO’s intelligence and production areas. Our vision is to transform analytic workflows, increasing automation and augmentation through the application of data science and machine analytics. We work closely with a range of stakeholders to understand their analytic requirements, and deliver new tools and methodologies that enable them to achieve more efficient and innovative outcomes. We foster a data-driven culture that supports analysts to gain deeper insights from larger volumes of data. We provide opportunities for continuous learning and developing, including funding for tertiary qualifications in machine analytics, and the opportunity to engage with industry and academia.


Successful candidates will be highly motivated, have strong oral and communication skills, with broad knowledge of geospatial data applications and analytical techniques. In addition, they will be able to work both individually and as part of a team, build and maintain productive working relationships with diverse stakeholders, and proactively address skill/knowledge gaps.

They will be resilient problem solvers, willing to engage with ambiguity and are able to harness collective knowledge to optimise outcomes. They will also be possess some of the following:

The Morbidity Audits Team is responsible for implementing and maintaining clinical audit databases that support fellows in improving and maintaining standards of surgical care.
Reporting to the Project Lead, Morbidity Audits, the Research Data Officer works closely with all Project Leads and other departmental and College staff in providing data analysis, research and systems support, and other routine activities of Morbidity Audits.
The keys areas of focus for this role are supporting the Morbidity Audits Team in the development, maintenance and implementation of Morbidity Projects, particularly data requests, extraction and the delivery of custom reports, data cleansing and database maintenance.
The role is for a fixed term for 2 years with possible further contract renewal.

The Bureau's Research Program sits within the Science and Innovation Group and is the main driver of world-class science-based innovation in the Bureau of Meteorology aligned with the Group’s R&D Plan 2020-2030. In supporting the Bureau to deliver impactful weather, water, climate, oceans and earth system prediction services, the research contributes to advancing meteorological and earth system sciences in Australia and globally. Research activities cover the broad fields of weather, climate, oceanography, land surface, and earth systems modelling, data set development, process studies, and application development.

The Hydrological Modelling team of the Bureau’s Research Program is seeking to fill the role of Scientist – Earth System Scientist. The successful candidate will lead novel research into hydrological and land surface dynamics modelling within the Hydrological Modelling team. A particular focus of this role is on the future operational land surface model’s re-parameterisation and verification (vegetation and soil physics) and in particular leading the Hydrological Modelling team’s work on the assimilation of new or novel observations into the land surface scheme. The successful candidate is also expected to contribute to discussions and take in part responsibility of the definition and progression of the Hydrological Modelling team’s main aims, using their understanding of customer needs.

The Earth System Scientist role is to lead relevant work packages within the Hydrological Modelling research program, and collaborate on select projects scientific and technical staff across the Research Program and other Bureau employees, as well as external stakeholders, in particular from the UK MetOffice and UK Centre for Environment and Hydrology. This requires the successful candidate to have experience in liaising effectively with such partners.
Tasks include developing research plans and overseeing their delivery within the designated work packages, including hands-on work on Earth observation data assessments, parameterisation of the land surface schemes within continental-scale hydrological/land surface models, and undertaking data assimilation experiments together with colleagues across the Research program, using scripting and coding languages (e.g. Python) on the Bureau’s and NCI’s Linux systems.

Where relevant, the Earth System Scientist will also contribute or lead strategic initiatives of broader value to the entire Bureau (e.g. the National Satellite Program on Earth Observations).

Executive Level 2 (SRS) - Ongoing
$125,053 - $146,999 + 15.4% super
Any Bureau’s State or Territory capital city office
The Bureau's Research Program sits within the Science and Innovation Group and is the main driver of world-class science-based innovation in the Bureau of Meteorology aligned with the Group’s R&D Plan 2020-2030. In supporting the Bureau to deliver impactful weather, water, climate, oceans and earth system prediction services, the research contributes to advancing meteorological and earth system sciences in Australia and globally. Research activities cover the broad fields of weather, climate, oceanography, land surface, and earth systems modelling, data set development, process studies, and application development.

The Hydrological Modelling team of the Bureau’s Research Program is seeking to fill the role of Scientist – Earth System Scientist. The successful candidate will lead novel research into hydrological and land surface dynamics modelling within the Hydrological Modelling team. A particular focus of this role is on the future operational land surface model’s re-parameterisation and verification (vegetation and soil physics) and in particular leading the Hydrological Modelling team’s work on the assimilation of new or novel observations into the land surface scheme. The successful candidate is also expected to contribute to discussions and take in part responsibility of the definition and progression of the Hydrological Modelling team’s main aims, using their understanding of customer needs.

The Earth System Scientist role is to lead relevant work packages within the Hydrological Modelling research program, and collaborate on select projects scientific and technical staff across the Research Program and other Bureau employees, as well as external stakeholders, in particular from the UK MetOffice and UK Centre for Environment and Hydrology. This requires the successful candidate to have experience in liaising effectively with such partners.
Tasks include developing research plans and overseeing their delivery within the designated work packages, including hands-on work on Earth observation data assessments, parameterisation of the land surface schemes within continental-scale hydrological/land surface models, and undertaking data assimilation experiments together with colleagues across the Research program, using scripting and coding languages (e.g. Python) on the Bureau’s and NCI’s Linux systems.

Where relevant, the Earth System Scientist will also contribute or lead strategic initiatives of broader value to the entire Bureau (e.g. the National Satellite Program on Earth Observations).

The Sustainability and Climate Change advisory team is growing and requires a number of outstanding, innovative and engaging professionals to join the team – that’s where you come in. The Sustainability and Climate Change team is privileged to be working on one of the most pressing issues of this century. Through our services, we help our clients understand, engage with and act on their sustainability-related risks and opportunities.

About our Sustainability & Climate Change team

Our highly diverse and multi-disciplinary team combines deep subject matter expertise, strategic thinking, and data and technology to meet the equally diverse and fast-evolving needs of our clients.

This role is Canberra based. The Canberra sustainability and climate team are focussed on working with government and public sector to help support, design, implement, and enhance climate and sustainability related policy and programs.

The broader practice’s experience and expertise spans Sustainability (or “ESG”) Strategy, Impact Measurement, Climate Risk and Strategy, Work Health and Safety, Crisis Management and Resilience, Risk Culture, Human Rights and Ethics, across a range of reporting and advisory client engagements.

What will your typical day look like?

We are looking for an Analyst to join our practice. In your role you will be part of a team delivering innovative solutions to government clients with the opportunity to work closely with our local, regional and global teams.

You will have a minimum baseline security clearance (or the ability to obtain), experience working with governments or demonstrated transferrable skills. Federal government experience will be highly regarded, as will project management, stakeholder engagement, technology and digitisation skills – especially as demonstrated in the climate change context.

You will be part of a leading practice working with the best clients with the guarantee of no day being the same. Your role will include:

Delivering engagements for a range of government clients, predominately focussed on Federal Government portfolios including Department of Defence but also including State Government departments and other public sector clients

Delivering engagements that relate to climate mitigation, climate adaptation, climate risk and resilience across a range of sectors (e.g. water, agriculture, food, built environment, digitisation), and disaster risk reduction

Supporting the development of innovative solutions leveraging data and technology and the best of Deloitte’s global IP

Building and maintaining client relationships

The opportunity to take charge of your career and make an impact that matters for our clients

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You will bring a good understanding of climate, both mitigation and adaptation, along with experience working with or for government entities. You will bring a strong passion to make a difference for our clients and in both supporting and enhancing governments with their mandate. You will be a self-starter and team player who thrives on meaningful and challenging opportunities – we want you to build a great career with us. You will be cognisant and respectful of Australia’s First Nation’s values.


1-3 years’ experience relating to working with government, industry, non-profit or private sector clients on topics relating to climate and/or sustainability

Demonstrated ability to understand and engage with the public policy landscape, including regulatory frameworks, machinations of government, and mandate to deliver meaningful outcomes

A degree or equivalent in law, public policy, environmental science, engineering, business, international development, or technologyin sustainability, environment, science, engineering, international development, finance or business with a passion to apply your expertise to real world client problems

Demonstrated strong analytical skills, and be able to effectively draw insights from research and data to support inform ESG solutions for clients

The ability, drive and determination to methodically work through complex problems at speed and synthesise into clear and impactful communications, without forsaking quality

Demonstrated ability to work withinin a diverse team environment

An ability to and build long-lasting and meaningful relationships with diverse stakeholders

We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. The Bureau's Research Program sits within the Science and Innovation Group and is the main driver of world-class science-based innovation in the Bureau of Meteorology aligned with the Group’s R&D Plan 2020-2030. In supporting the Bureau to deliver impactful weather, water, climate, oceans and earth system prediction services, the research contributes to advancing meteorological and earth system sciences in Australia and globally. Research activities cover the broad fields of weather, climate, oceanography, land surface, and earth systems modelling, data set development, process studies, and application development.

The Hydrological Modelling team of the Bureau’s Research Program is seeking to fill the role of Scientist – Hydrologist (APS6). The successful candidate will contribute to the implementation and validation of the future operational continental routing scheme, as well as working with other scientists in the team to model the impact of soil hydrology and groundwater dynamics on the surface runoff generation. The successful candidate will take responsibility of the model verification within the Hydrological Modelling team and will closely collaborate with Hydrological Information and Surface Observations team, which leads the verification work within the section. Contribution to scientific discussions in support of the progression and definition of the Hydrological Modelling team’s main aims would be expected.

Tasks include developing plans to achieve milestones and overseeing their delivery within the designated work packages, including hands-on work on model data assessments, parameterisation of the routing schemes within continental-scale hydrological/land surface models, and if desired undertaking data assimilation experiments together with colleagues across the Research program, using scripting and coding languages (e.g. Python) on the Bureau’s and NCI’s Linux systems.

Where relevant, the Scientist – Hydrologist (APS6) will also contribute to initiatives of broader value to the entire Bureau (e.g. supporting the SIG leadership team with administrative tasks, actively engaging with social groups within the agency).

The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences (CDMS) is seeking an enthusiastic and highly skilled candidate for the position of Governance and Compliance Officer. The position is located in the pooled area servicing the School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences and the School Engineering, Design and Built Environment.

The Governance and Compliance Officer will provide professional secretariat support to ensure that the requirements of School based misconduct and other committees are satisfied. The position requires strong Word, Excel and time management skills as well as experience dealing with internal and external stakeholders.

The successful candidate will need to have capacity to manage a wide range of administrative functions within a high volume work area to provide high quality service and will undertake time critical case management of student misconduct cases for both schools.

The position is a leave replacement up to 29 September 2023 at 0.6 FTE (3 days per week). The role is based at the Parramatta or Penrith campuses and the successful applicant may be required to travel to any of the of Western Sydney University campuses.

This challenging work is undertaken in an inclusive and supportive environment and our intelligence plays a vital role in shaping the disruption and mitigation of dynamic and evolving threats.




Our ideal candidate is a curious, collaborative individual who is not afraid of a challenge, and be able to:
Prior experience or skills in cyber security is desirable but not mandatory. Applicants with experience or qualifications in any of the skills, disciplines or platforms listed below are strongly encouraged to apply:

Executive Level 2 (SRS) - Ongoing
$125,053 - $146,999 + 15.4% super
Any Bureau’s State or Territory capital city office
The Bureau's Research Program sits within the Science and Innovation Group and is the main driver of world-class science-based innovation in the Bureau of Meteorology aligned with the Group’s R&D Plan 2020-2030. In supporting the Bureau to deliver impactful weather, water, climate, oceans and earth system prediction services, the research contributes to advancing meteorological and earth system sciences in Australia and globally. Research activities cover the broad fields of weather, climate, oceanography, land surface, and earth systems modelling, data set development, process studies, and application development.

The Hydrological Modelling team of the Bureau’s Research Program is seeking to fill the role of Scientist – Earth System Scientist. The successful candidate will lead novel research into hydrological and land surface dynamics modelling within the Hydrological Modelling team. A particular focus of this role is on the future operational land surface model’s re-parameterisation and verification (vegetation and soil physics) and in particular leading the Hydrological Modelling team’s work on the assimilation of new or novel observations into the land surface scheme. The successful candidate is also expected to contribute to discussions and take in part responsibility of the definition and progression of the Hydrological Modelling team’s main aims, using their understanding of customer needs.

The Earth System Scientist role is to lead relevant work packages within the Hydrological Modelling research program, and collaborate on select projects scientific and technical staff across the Research Program and other Bureau employees, as well as external stakeholders, in particular from the UK MetOffice and UK Centre for Environment and Hydrology. This requires the successful candidate to have experience in liaising effectively with such partners.
Tasks include developing research plans and overseeing their delivery within the designated work packages, including hands-on work on Earth observation data assessments, parameterisation of the land surface schemes within continental-scale hydrological/land surface models, and undertaking data assimilation experiments together with colleagues across the Research program, using scripting and coding languages (e.g. Python) on the Bureau’s and NCI’s Linux systems.

Where relevant, the Earth System Scientist will also contribute or lead strategic initiatives of broader value to the entire Bureau (e.g. the National Satellite Program on Earth Observations).

The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is the national authority for information security and through its Work Experience Program offers students from Years 11-12 an opportunity to extend their knowledge and skills in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM), with a focus on information/cyber security.

High achieving Year 10 Students with a strong interest in this field are also encouraged to apply and may be considered for a placement.

Students undertaking the ASD Work Experience Program will be required to work in a team and are mentored throughout the program by experienced security professionals from ASD who have a high level of expertise in their field. This placement demands strong interest and a high level of competency in mathematics, ICT, engineering or science (STEM). Students applying to participate should be excelling in one or more of these areas and have a sound computing and programming background.

The ASD Work Experience Program offers a number of challenges designed to increase STEM knowledge and understanding, such as:


At the completion of the ASD Work Experience Program, students will present their achievements to mentors, work experience coordinators/teachers, parents and ASD leadership. Students interested in this program are encouraged to discuss their placement with their STEM teachers or careers advisor. Students may apply for multiple placements but can only attend the program once.

The ASD Work Experience Program is conducted at the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) in Canberra. Students from ALL states and territories in Australia are eligible to apply.

All placements are subject to relevant State/ Territory COVID-19 Guidelines and Defence Restrictions. This may result in a placement being changed, postponed and/ or cancelled at short notice.

About Western
Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing and economically significant region, Western Sydney. Boasting 11 campuses – many in Western Sydney CBD locations – and more than 200,000 alumni, 49,500 students and 3,500 staff, the University has 14 Schools with an array of well-designed programs and degrees carefully structured to meet the demands of future industry. Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing economically significant region, Western Sydney.

Benefits
Western Sydney University has long been identified as a University of the people. We value the contributions made by our staff and recognise that they underpin the enablement of our mission and values. In return, we offer:


The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences is located in the Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Cluster, together with the School of Engineering, Design and Built Environment, the School of Science, the MARCS Institute and the Hawkesbury Institute for the Environment.

The School offers both undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including research programs that combine advanced academic knowledge with real-life training to suit a range of career needs and interests in the following disciplines: Computer Science and Information Technologies, Data Sciences and Mathematics. The School conducts world leading research in main themes including Intelligent Decision Making, Computing for Sustainability and Equality and Foundation, Algorithms and Discovery.

We seek an energetic, forward-thinking, dynamic, and innovative scholar to take on a Postdoctoral Research Fellowship for a full-time, fixed-term role for one year to work on On-Board Federated Learning in Orbital Edge Computing for Space Situational Awareness. The appointed applicant will undertake research in Edge Computing focusing on federated learning and reconfigurable computing.


The successful applicant is expected to be developing a strong international standing and research reputation, have an excellent research background in the field of edge computing and machine learning, have demonstrated track record of publication of high-quality papers in top journals and conferences in the field, and capacity to undertake independent research.

The position is a full-time, fixed term role until 30 September 2023, based at the Parramatta South Campus.

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

Rare Opportunity to Work with Australia’s top Scientists in Research

THE CLIENT

Executive Level 2 (SRS) - Ongoing
$125,053 - $146,999 + 15.4% super
Any Bureau’s State or Territory capital city office
The Bureau's Research Program sits within the Science and Innovation Group and is the main driver of world-class science-based innovation in the Bureau of Meteorology aligned with the Group’s R&D Plan 2020-2030. In supporting the Bureau to deliver impactful weather, water, climate, oceans and earth system prediction services, the research contributes to advancing meteorological and earth system sciences in Australia and globally. Research activities cover the broad fields of weather, climate, oceanography, land surface, and earth systems modelling, data set development, process studies, and application development.

The Hydrological Modelling team of the Bureau’s Research Program is seeking to fill the role of Scientist – Earth System Scientist. The successful candidate will lead novel research into hydrological and land surface dynamics modelling within the Hydrological Modelling team. A particular focus of this role is on the future operational land surface model’s re-parameterisation and verification (vegetation and soil physics) and in particular leading the Hydrological Modelling team’s work on the assimilation of new or novel observations into the land surface scheme. The successful candidate is also expected to contribute to discussions and take in part responsibility of the definition and progression of the Hydrological Modelling team’s main aims, using their understanding of customer needs.

The Earth System Scientist role is to lead relevant work packages within the Hydrological Modelling research program, and collaborate on select projects scientific and technical staff across the Research Program and other Bureau employees, as well as external stakeholders, in particular from the UK MetOffice and UK Centre for Environment and Hydrology. This requires the successful candidate to have experience in liaising effectively with such partners.
Tasks include developing research plans and overseeing their delivery within the designated work packages, including hands-on work on Earth observation data assessments, parameterisation of the land surface schemes within continental-scale hydrological/land surface models, and undertaking data assimilation experiments together with colleagues across the Research program, using scripting and coding languages (e.g. Python) on the Bureau’s and NCI’s Linux systems.

Where relevant, the Earth System Scientist will also contribute or lead strategic initiatives of broader value to the entire Bureau (e.g. the National Satellite Program on Earth Observations).

The Opportunity
Conduct varied ecological fieldwork and glasshouse experiments
Contribute to research improving our ability to understand, manage and restore Australian ecological communities and facilitate their adaptation to climate change

The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences (CDMS) is seeking an enthusiastic and highly skilled candidate for the position of Governance and Compliance Officer. The Governance and Compliance Officer will provide professional secretariat support to ensure that the requirements of School based misconduct and other committees are satisfied. The position requires strong Word, Excel and time management skills as well as experience dealing with internal and external stakeholders.

The successful candidate will need to have capacity to manage a wide range of administrative functions within a high volume work area to provide high quality service and will undertake time critical case management of student misconduct cases for both schools.

Job Description:
Full-time, fixed term until 30 September 2023
Remuneration: $127,812 to $150,817 p.a.
Parramatta South campus
About Western
Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing and economically significant region, Western Sydney. Boasting 11 campuses – many in Western Sydney CBD locations – and more than 200,000 alumni, 49,500 students and 3,500 staff, the University has 14 Schools with an array of well-designed programs and degrees carefully structured to meet the demands of future industry. Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing economically significant region, Western Sydney.

Benefits
Western Sydney University has long been identified as a University of the people. We value the contributions made by our staff and recognise that they underpin the enablement of our mission and values. In return, we offer:


The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences is located in the Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Cluster, together with the School of Engineering, Design and Built Environment, the School of Science, the MARCS Institute and the Hawkesbury Institute for the Environment.

The School offers both undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including research programs that combine advanced academic knowledge with real-life training to suit a range of career needs and interests in the following disciplines: Computer Science and Information Technologies, Data Sciences and Mathematics. The School conducts world leading research in main themes including Intelligent Decision Making, Computing for Sustainability and Equality and Foundation, Algorithms and Discovery.

We seek an energetic, forward-thinking, dynamic, and innovative scholar to take on a Postdoctoral Research Fellowship for a full-time, fixed-term role for one year to work on On-Board Federated Learning in Orbital Edge Computing for Space Situational Awareness. The appointed applicant will undertake research in Edge Computing focusing on federated learning and reconfigurable computing.


The successful applicant is expected to be developing a strong international standing and research reputation, have an excellent research background in the field of edge computing and machine learning, have demonstrated track record of publication of high-quality papers in top journals and conferences in the field, and capacity to undertake independent research.

The position is a full-time, fixed term role until 30 September 2023, based at the Parramatta South Campus.

Please refer to the position description for more information.

Job Title: ASD Cyber Security and Robotics Work Experience Program
Job Description:
Australian Public Service
Brindabella Park, ACT
25 - 29 September 2023
The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is the national authority for information security and through its Work Experience Program offers students from Years 11-12 an opportunity to extend their knowledge and skills in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM), with a focus on information/cyber security.

High achieving Year 10 Students with a strong interest in this field are also encouraged to apply and may be considered for a placement.

Students undertaking the ASD Work Experience Program will be required to work in a team and are mentored throughout the program by experienced security professionals from ASD who have a high level of expertise in their field. This placement demands strong interest and a high level of competency in mathematics, ICT, engineering or science (STEM). Students applying to participate should be excelling in one or more of these areas and have a sound computing and programming background.

The ASD Work Experience Program offers a number of challenges designed to increase STEM knowledge and understanding, such as:


At the completion of the ASD Work Experience Program, students will present their achievements to mentors, work experience coordinators/teachers, parents and ASD leadership. Students interested in this program are encouraged to discuss their placement with their STEM teachers or careers advisor. Students may apply for multiple placements but can only attend the program once.

The ASD Work Experience Program is conducted at the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) in Canberra. Students from ALL states and territories in Australia are eligible to apply.

All placements are subject to relevant State/ Territory COVID-19 Guidelines and Defence Restrictions. This may result in a placement being changed, postponed and/ or cancelled at short notice.

The Role
Are you a dynamic, motivated and innovative individual looking for a career opportunity where you can really make a difference?

We are seeking a motivated analyst with passion, creativity, good judgment and adaptability to help us drive innovation and develop Defence’s future capability edge.

You will collate and analyse program information, develop options and conduct detailed planning to support executive decision making and other governance activity in the newly created Innovation, Science and Technology (IS&T) Capability Program Management Office (PgMO).

You will be required to think strategically and understand how the PgMO’s work contributes to the achievement of wider Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) and Defence capability outcomes.

You will be responsible for drawing insights that will shape program decisions by discovering patterns, anomalies and trends in data, advising on data quality, using relevant business systems or applications.

To do all of this, you can apply a structured analysis, planning and decision making approach and can manage your time effectively.

You will work closely with the IS&T PgMO Director and Deputy Director PgMO - Governance and Decision Support and the Program Information Management Support Officer, who will help you conduct research and manage program information.

You will work with the DSTG Portfolio team to ensure program reporting and risk management practices are consistent with Group needs and vice versa.


The IS&T Capability Program is responsible for delivering the agile defence innovation system and research infrastructure that will enable Defence to develop its future capability edge.

The IS&T Capability Program Management Office (PgMO) provides the Chief Defence Scientist and IS&T Capability Program executives with the support they need to make timely decisions and drive program performance. In this critical enabling role, the PgMO supports all IS&T Capability Program governance and is responsible for driving adoption of new programmatic ways of delivering capability in DSTG.

The PgMO also supports integration with other programs and DSTG elements, and coordinates and delivers support and guidance to the IS&T Projects that deliver many of those outcomes.


Our ideal candidate is a high performing problem solver who is comfortable working as part of a close team in a fast paced, analysis and planning function.

Previous experience where you were required to draw strategic insights through the detailed analysis of information and present convincing arguments to support executive decision-making is essential.

ABOUT US

Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world’s most ambitious change makers define the future.
Across 65 cities in 40 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition, and redefine industries. We complement our tailored, integrated expertise with a vibrant ecosystem of digital innovators to deliver better, faster, and more enduring outcomes. Our 10-year commitment to invest more than $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise, and insight to organizations tackling today’s urgent challenges in education, racial equity, social justice, economic development, and the environment. We earned a gold rating from EcoVadis, the leading platform for environmental, social, and ethical performance ratings for global supply chains, putting us in the top 2% of all companies. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

The Advanced Analytics Group is a team of experts in data science, engineering, marketing science, operations research and primary research. You will work alongside Bain’s consulting teams to provide high quality results for our clients, some of the most successful and pioneering businesses in the world.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

We are always looking for ambitious and curious-minded colleagues who are keen to make a difference.

Job Title: EL 1 (S&T 5) - Co-operative Multiplatform Autonomy Senior Researcher (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Software Development)
Job Description:
$108,195 - $122,044 (plus Super)
Edinburgh - SA


The Role
The Co-operative Multiplatform Autonomy Senior Researcher will work within the Autonomous C5ISREW Discipline and depending on expertise and interest could apply their skills to a number of research activities focusing on counter un-crewed aerial systems (CUAS), machine vision, sensor positioning for internet of military things (IOMT), information management across tactical communication networks (TCN) and network signature management.

The Co-operative Multiplatform Autonomy Senior Researcher will be expected to lead the technical and scientific aspects of a research activity, with limited guidance from the Discipline Leader, Autonomous C5IRSEW and the Group Leader SITN (Systems Integration and Tactical Coordination). Technical leadership will include providing leadership to software development and machine learning and simulation activities, and may involve managing software development contracts. Scientific leadership will include planning of research activities and authorship of scientific publications in collaboration with external and internal partners and may include managing research agreements. The senior researcher will also be expected to participate in field trials and demonstrations.


The Systems Integration and Tactical coordination (SITN) team conducts research and development towards novel approaches to distributed autonomy for co-operative multiplatform effects. Our research programs seek to autonomously control sensor, effector and communications technologies across multiplatform systems including combat vehicles, soldier systems, autonomous platforms and IoT devices. Our science and engineering aims to enhance survivability and mission success for the warfighter through collaborative protected manoeuvre in contested environments. The team applies skills in machine learning, computer science and artificial intelligence, developing and leveraging leading-edge technologies from across DSTG, industry, academia and international agencies in close partnership with the ADF, making significant contributions to Defence projects and long-range research.


The senior researcher should have the following characteristics:

Job Description:
Travers bushfire & ecology have been undertaking Aboriginal and Heritage Assessments for over 20 years. With our current heritage specialist retiring, an opportunity has opened up for an Aboriginal heritage assessment consultant to join our team and to expand our existing services in this discipline working through out NSW based on the Central Coast.
This is a unique opportunity for an energetic person looking for a long-term role in this field and wanting to create a service based on cultural diversity and respect for the land.
About the roles
Provide high quality heritage advice and services to a range of stakeholders in relation to the Aboriginal Heritage Act 2006 and the Heritage Act 2017.
Delivery of legislative advice, preparation of due diligence reports, preparation of Cultural Heritage Management Plans and Salvage Excavations for management of Indigenous cultural heritage, and the preparation and implementation of Consents and Permits to manage historic heritage.

Western Sydney University Internal Applicants Only.

To be eligible to apply for this position you must be employed by Western Sydney University on an ongoing, fixed term or casual basis at the time of this advertisement.

All ongoing and fixed term employees seeking to apply for this position as a secondment must have completed a minimum of 12 months’ full-time continuous service to be eligible to apply for this role, as per Part D of the Recruitment and Selection Policy.

The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences (CDMS) is seeking an enthusiastic and highly skilled candidate for the position of Governance and Compliance Officer. The position is located in the pooled area servicing the School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences and the School Engineering, Design and Built Environment.

The Governance and Compliance Officer will provide professional secretariat support to ensure that the requirements of School based misconduct and other committees are satisfied. The position requires strong Word, Excel and time management skills as well as experience dealing with internal and external stakeholders.

The successful candidate will need to have capacity to manage a wide range of administrative functions within a high volume work area to provide high quality service and will undertake time critical case management of student misconduct cases for both schools.

The position is a leave replacement up to 29 September 2023 at 0.6 FTE (3 days per week). The role is based at the Parramatta or Penrith campuses and the successful applicant may be required to travel to any of the of Western Sydney University campuses.

If this sounds like you, apply now and ensure you address all items in the selection criteria in your application.

Job Title: , Research Fellow in Edge Computing, School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences
Job Description:
Full-time, fixed term until 30 September 2023
Remuneration: $127,812 to $150,817 p.a.
Parramatta South campus
About Western
Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing and economically significant region, Western Sydney. Boasting 11 campuses – many in Western Sydney CBD locations – and more than 200,000 alumni, 49,500 students and 3,500 staff, the University has 14 Schools with an array of well-designed programs and degrees carefully structured to meet the demands of future industry. Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing economically significant region, Western Sydney.

Benefits
Western Sydney University has long been identified as a University of the people. We value the contributions made by our staff and recognise that they underpin the enablement of our mission and values. In return, we offer:


The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences is located in the Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Cluster, together with the School of Engineering, Design and Built Environment, the School of Science, the MARCS Institute and the Hawkesbury Institute for the Environment.

The School offers both undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including research programs that combine advanced academic knowledge with real-life training to suit a range of career needs and interests in the following disciplines: Computer Science and Information Technologies, Data Sciences and Mathematics. The School conducts world leading research in main themes including Intelligent Decision Making, Computing for Sustainability and Equality and Foundation, Algorithms and Discovery.

We seek an energetic, forward-thinking, dynamic, and innovative scholar to take on a Postdoctoral Research Fellowship for a full-time, fixed-term role for one year to work on On-Board Federated Learning in Orbital Edge Computing for Space Situational Awareness. The appointed applicant will undertake research in Edge Computing focusing on federated learning and reconfigurable computing.


The successful applicant is expected to be developing a strong international standing and research reputation, have an excellent research background in the field of edge computing and machine learning, have demonstrated track record of publication of high-quality papers in top journals and conferences in the field, and capacity to undertake independent research.

The position is a full-time, fixed term role until 30 September 2023, based at the Parramatta South Campus.

Please refer to the position description for more information.

Job Title: ASD Cyber Security and Robotics Work Experience Program
Job Description:
Australian Public Service
Brindabella Park, ACT
25 - 29 September 2023
The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is the national authority for information security and through its Work Experience Program offers students from Years 11-12 an opportunity to extend their knowledge and skills in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM), with a focus on information/cyber security.

High achieving Year 10 Students with a strong interest in this field are also encouraged to apply and may be considered for a placement.

Students undertaking the ASD Work Experience Program will be required to work in a team and are mentored throughout the program by experienced security professionals from ASD who have a high level of expertise in their field. This placement demands strong interest and a high level of competency in mathematics, ICT, engineering or science (STEM). Students applying to participate should be excelling in one or more of these areas and have a sound computing and programming background.

The ASD Work Experience Program offers a number of challenges designed to increase STEM knowledge and understanding, such as:


At the completion of the ASD Work Experience Program, students will present their achievements to mentors, work experience coordinators/teachers, parents and ASD leadership. Students interested in this program are encouraged to discuss their placement with their STEM teachers or careers advisor. Students may apply for multiple placements but can only attend the program once.

The ASD Work Experience Program is conducted at the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) in Canberra. Students from ALL states and territories in Australia are eligible to apply.

All placements are subject to relevant State/ Territory COVID-19 Guidelines and Defence Restrictions. This may result in a placement being changed, postponed and/ or cancelled at short notice.

Job Title: Sales Specialist, Investment Research and Data Science
Job Description:
Role Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:
Seeks new business or new product sales through new account acquisition and / or penetration of new buyer hubs and delivers against target in assigned territory
Inspires confidence in customers through domain expertise. Integrates knowledge of industry trends and personal experience to deliver value to customer(s).
Builds value-add connections within the client organization, leveraging network to facilitate introductions and unlock previously inaccessible opportunities.
Proactively thinks through customer workflows and how they can be impacted as a basis for solutions selling and cross-business deal making to maximize contract value
Conducts high-efficiency, high-output prospecting; collaborates effectively with lead-gen, account management, and other colleagues ensuring constant coverage of expansion opportunities and participation in customer life-cycle framework

$85,607 - $97,790 (plus Super)
Fairbairn - ACT
The Role
Are you a dynamic, motivated and innovative individual looking for a career opportunity where you can really make a difference?

We are seeking a motivated analyst with passion, creativity, good judgment and adaptability to help us drive innovation and develop Defence’s future capability edge.

You will collate and analyse program information, develop options and conduct detailed planning to support executive decision making and other governance activity in the newly created Innovation, Science and Technology (IS&T) Capability Program Management Office (PgMO).

You will be required to think strategically and understand how the PgMO’s work contributes to the achievement of wider Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) and Defence capability outcomes.

You will be responsible for drawing insights that will shape program decisions by discovering patterns, anomalies and trends in data, advising on data quality, using relevant business systems or applications.

To do all of this, you can apply a structured analysis, planning and decision making approach and can manage your time effectively.

You will work closely with the IS&T PgMO Director and Deputy Director PgMO - Governance and Decision Support and the Program Information Management Support Officer, who will help you conduct research and manage program information.

You will work with the DSTG Portfolio team to ensure program reporting and risk management practices are consistent with Group needs and vice versa.


The IS&T Capability Program is responsible for delivering the agile defence innovation system and research infrastructure that will enable Defence to develop its future capability edge.

The IS&T Capability Program Management Office (PgMO) provides the Chief Defence Scientist and IS&T Capability Program executives with the support they need to make timely decisions and drive program performance. In this critical enabling role, the PgMO supports all IS&T Capability Program governance and is responsible for driving adoption of new programmatic ways of delivering capability in DSTG.

The PgMO also supports integration with other programs and DSTG elements, and coordinates and delivers support and guidance to the IS&T Projects that deliver many of those outcomes.


Our ideal candidate is a high performing problem solver who is comfortable working as part of a close team in a fast paced, analysis and planning function.

Previous experience where you were required to draw strategic insights through the detailed analysis of information and present convincing arguments to support executive decision-making is essential.

Kewdale-based Opportunity

The Company
Pacific Energy Group (PEG) has a long and proud history of delivering power and energy solutions for our customers safety and reliably for over 40 years. We use multiple technologies that include and integrate gas, diesel, wind, solar, and battery storage. We are leading energy specialists building, owning, and operating power generating assets for mining companies, businesses, townships, and State-owned utilities across Australia. We are a trusted partner from concept right through project.

We are always looking for ambitious and curious-minded colleagues who are keen to make a difference.


We are seeking a motivated student who is looking for an exciting opportunity to expand their education with vacation employment over the holiday break.
Run from December 2022 to February 2023 (aligned to your university break).
You will work closely with and be supported by your assigned mentor and supervisor for the duration of the program. Your mentor will provide regular progress reviews.

If you are passionate about a sustainable future and want to develop your technical and professional data science skills through hands-on experience in the sustainability team, come and join us. Typical assignments may include creating processes to easily capture critical ESG data across the business to support ongoing reporting requirements.


All candidates must submit a cover letter, resume and their latest academic results as part of the application. Resumes must include 2 business or academic references.
Only applicants with unrestricted work rights in Western Australia will be eligible to apply


At Pacific Energy we value the richness and depth diversity brings. Applicants from diverse backgrounds, people of all ages, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and gender identities are encouraged to apply. We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process and accommodate people of all abilities throughout their employment.

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world’s most ambitious change makers define the future.
Across 65 cities in 40 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition, and redefine industries. We complement our tailored, integrated expertise with a vibrant ecosystem of digital innovators to deliver better, faster, and more enduring outcomes. Our 10-year commitment to invest more than $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise, and insight to organizations tackling today’s urgent challenges in education, racial equity, social justice, economic development, and the environment. We earned a gold rating from EcoVadis, the leading platform for environmental, social, and ethical performance ratings for global supply chains, putting us in the top 2% of all companies. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

Job Title: EL 1 (S&T 5) - Co-operative Multiplatform Autonomy Senior Researcher (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Software Development)
Job Description:
$108,195 - $122,044 (plus Super)
Edinburgh - SA


The Role
The Co-operative Multiplatform Autonomy Senior Researcher will work within the Autonomous C5ISREW Discipline and depending on expertise and interest could apply their skills to a number of research activities focusing on counter un-crewed aerial systems (CUAS), machine vision, sensor positioning for internet of military things (IOMT), information management across tactical communication networks (TCN) and network signature management.

The Co-operative Multiplatform Autonomy Senior Researcher will be expected to lead the technical and scientific aspects of a research activity, with limited guidance from the Discipline Leader, Autonomous C5IRSEW and the Group Leader SITN (Systems Integration and Tactical Coordination). Technical leadership will include providing leadership to software development and machine learning and simulation activities, and may involve managing software development contracts. Scientific leadership will include planning of research activities and authorship of scientific publications in collaboration with external and internal partners and may include managing research agreements. The senior researcher will also be expected to participate in field trials and demonstrations.


The Systems Integration and Tactical coordination (SITN) team conducts research and development towards novel approaches to distributed autonomy for co-operative multiplatform effects. Our research programs seek to autonomously control sensor, effector and communications technologies across multiplatform systems including combat vehicles, soldier systems, autonomous platforms and IoT devices. Our science and engineering aims to enhance survivability and mission success for the warfighter through collaborative protected manoeuvre in contested environments. The team applies skills in machine learning, computer science and artificial intelligence, developing and leveraging leading-edge technologies from across DSTG, industry, academia and international agencies in close partnership with the ADF, making significant contributions to Defence projects and long-range research.


The senior researcher should have the following characteristics:

Job Title: EL 2 (S&T Level 6) - Research Specialist Software Vulnerabilities
Job Description:
$125,622 - $150,785 (plus Super)
Canberra - ACT


The Role
The Research Specialist Software Vulnerabilities will carry out scientific and technical research for program analysis of (source or binary) software of operational significance for Defence and National Security.

You will research and develop new program analysis techniques to be applied to software systems and work collaboratively with the Discipline Leader of Software Systems Security to maintain a world class team of software researcher and developers that discover, assess and defend against vulnerabilities across a diverse cyber landscape.

Duties and Key Result Areas:


The Cyber & Signals Intelligence (CSI) MSTC develops concepts, techniques and technologies for understanding cyberspace and the electromagnetic spectrum, supporting the intelligence and electronic surveillance needs of Defence.

CSI MSTC collaborates with a wide range of research organisations both nationally and internationally. CSI is primarily located at the DST Edinburgh site, with a presence also in Canberra.

Access Technologies (AT) undertakes R&D in technologies for cyber access and bespoke wireless communication, with a focus on physical layer RF communications and ICT system security.

The Software Systems Security Discipline in which this position resides, undertakes research and development that delivers advanced program analyses for discovering vulnerabilities in software. This includes reasoning about program behaviours and spans fundamental research to tools development for vulnerability research practitioners. Core skills within the discipline include dynamic, static and symbolic analysis underpinned by deep software engineering expertise.


Our ideal candidate will have a passion for program analysis applied to cyber security, with experience or aptitude in several of the following areas:
You will bring experience in the application of scientific techniques, with the ability to enhance Defence capabilities through innovation and collaboration with industry, academia and Government.

You will have the following:

Job Title: Aboriginal & Cultural Heritage Assessment Consultant (honours degree, or higher, involving studies in Australian Indigenous and non-Indigenous archaeology)
Job Description:
Travers bushfire & ecology have been undertaking Aboriginal and Heritage Assessments for over 20 years. With our current heritage specialist retiring, an opportunity has opened up for an Aboriginal heritage assessment consultant to join our team and to expand our existing services in this discipline working through out NSW based on the Central Coast.
This is a unique opportunity for an energetic person looking for a long-term role in this field and wanting to create a service based on cultural diversity and respect for the land.
About the roles
Provide high quality heritage advice and services to a range of stakeholders in relation to the Aboriginal Heritage Act 2006 and the Heritage Act 2017.
Delivery of legislative advice, preparation of due diligence reports, preparation of Cultural Heritage Management Plans and Salvage Excavations for management of Indigenous cultural heritage, and the preparation and implementation of Consents and Permits to manage historic heritage.

Job Title: APS 5, 6 (Multiple Classifications) - Geospatial Data Analyst / Geospatial Data Scientist
Job Description:
$78,143 - $97,790 (plus Super)
Russell - ACT
The Role
APS5/6 – Data Analyst

This role will leverage your understanding of statistics, Geospatial Information Systems (GIS), and programming. You will work as part of a team to develop and implement new tools and methodologies that use AGO’s data and GIS more effectively and efficiently. You will work with a range of stakeholders, including AGO’s intelligence analysts, data scientists and capability managers, ensuring your analytics meet user requirements, are rigorous and consistent with AGO’s system environment.

APS5/6 – Data Scientist

This role will leverage your experience in Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI), data analysis and automation, to assist AGO to derive deeper insights from larger volumes of data, and at a pace that enables decision advantage. You will liaise with a range of stakeholders to evaluate and implement ML/AI technologies that drive innovation and modernise AGO’s analytic practices.

Both roles will support AGO staff to increase their digital and data fluency.


The Australian Geospatial-Intelligence Organisation (AGO) makes a critical contribution to protect the lives and safety of Australians at home and overseas by providing accurate and timely geospatial-intelligence to support decision makers at all levels.

The Data Innovation and Analytics Directorate (DIAD) is a team of highly motivated data specialists who provide analytical support to AGO’s intelligence and production areas. Our vision is to transform analytic workflows, increasing automation and augmentation through the application of data science and machine analytics. We work closely with a range of stakeholders to understand their analytic requirements, and deliver new tools and methodologies that enable them to achieve more efficient and innovative outcomes. We foster a data-driven culture that supports analysts to gain deeper insights from larger volumes of data. We provide opportunities for continuous learning and developing, including funding for tertiary qualifications in machine analytics, and the opportunity to engage with industry and academia.


Successful candidates will be highly motivated, have strong oral and communication skills, with broad knowledge of geospatial data applications and analytical techniques. In addition, they will be able to work both individually and as part of a team, build and maintain productive working relationships with diverse stakeholders, and proactively address skill/knowledge gaps.

They will be resilient problem solvers, willing to engage with ambiguity and are able to harness collective knowledge to optimise outcomes. They will also be possess some of the following:

Job Title: Data Scientist - Procan Cancer Data Science (CDS)
Job Description:
Make an important contribution to the health of future generations through medical research
Work with a world-leading, independent medical research institute
Located in Westmead—Sydney’s and Australia’s foremost biomedical research precinct
Children’s Medical Research Institute (CMRI) was Australia’s first dedicated paediatric research facility and is now one of the world’s most highly regarded independent medical research organisations. Our research focuses on the four key areas impacting children’s health: cancer, genomics and genetic diseases, neurobiology, and embryology. Our strong international reputation is based on decades of significant research outcomes in these areas of specialty. CMRI is also home to the world-first proteomics project, ProCan, which is changing the way cancer is diagnosed and treated. CMRI’s research programs are supported by state of the art facilities and committed research and support staff. Our achievements are made possible by a loyal network of community supporters, highly engaged donors, and the very successful Jeans for Genes® and Great Cycle Challenge fundraising campaigns.

Executive Level 2 (SRS) - Ongoing
$125,053 - $146,999 + 15.4% super
Any Bureau’s State or Territory capital city office
The Bureau's Research Program sits within the Science and Innovation Group and is the main driver of world-class science-based innovation in the Bureau of Meteorology aligned with the Group’s R&D Plan 2020-2030. In supporting the Bureau to deliver impactful weather, water, climate, oceans and earth system prediction services, the research contributes to advancing meteorological and earth system sciences in Australia and globally. Research activities cover the broad fields of weather, climate, oceanography, land surface, and earth systems modelling, data set development, process studies, and application development.

The Hydrological Modelling team of the Bureau’s Research Program is seeking to fill the role of Scientist – Earth System Scientist. The successful candidate will lead novel research into hydrological and land surface dynamics modelling within the Hydrological Modelling team. A particular focus of this role is on the future operational land surface model’s re-parameterisation and verification (vegetation and soil physics) and in particular leading the Hydrological Modelling team’s work on the assimilation of new or novel observations into the land surface scheme. The successful candidate is also expected to contribute to discussions and take in part responsibility of the definition and progression of the Hydrological Modelling team’s main aims, using their understanding of customer needs.

The Earth System Scientist role is to lead relevant work packages within the Hydrological Modelling research program, and collaborate on select projects scientific and technical staff across the Research Program and other Bureau employees, as well as external stakeholders, in particular from the UK MetOffice and UK Centre for Environment and Hydrology. This requires the successful candidate to have experience in liaising effectively with such partners.
Tasks include developing research plans and overseeing their delivery within the designated work packages, including hands-on work on Earth observation data assessments, parameterisation of the land surface schemes within continental-scale hydrological/land surface models, and undertaking data assimilation experiments together with colleagues across the Research program, using scripting and coding languages (e.g. Python) on the Bureau’s and NCI’s Linux systems.

Where relevant, the Earth System Scientist will also contribute or lead strategic initiatives of broader value to the entire Bureau (e.g. the National Satellite Program on Earth Observations).

The School of Computer, Data and Mathematical Sciences (CDMS) is seeking an enthusiastic and highly skilled candidate for the position of Governance and Compliance Officer. The Governance and Compliance Officer will provide professional secretariat support to ensure that the requirements of School based misconduct and other committees are satisfied. The position requires strong Word, Excel and time management skills as well as experience dealing with internal and external stakeholders.
